title: Pre-QUES
text: Peta tutupan lahan dari dua periode waktu: Analisis perubahan lahan dimulai dengan membandingkan data peta tutupan lahan dari dua periode waktu yang berbeda. Ini memberikan gambaran tentang bagaimana lahan di suatu daerah berubah sepanjang waktu. Mengintegrasikan peta Unit Perencanaan: Data unit perencanaan kemudian dimasukkan dalam proses ini. Ini memungkinkan kita untuk melihat kecenderungan perubahan tutupan lahan pada masing-masing kelas unit perencanaan.

title: Pre-QUES
text: Hasil dari analisis ini berperan penting dalam proses perencanaan untuk berbagai aspek pembangunan. Berikut adalah beberapa aplikasinya: Menentukan Prioritas Pembangunan: Dengan memahami pola dan tren perubahan lahan, kita bisa menentukan area mana yang harus diberi prioritas dalam pembangunan. Mengidentifikasi Faktor Pemicu: Analisis ini membantu kita dalam mengidentifikasi faktor pemicu yang mempengaruhi perubahan penggunaan lahan. Perencanaan Skenario Masa Depan: Memahami perubahan masa lalu dan saat ini memungkinkan kita untuk merencanakan skenario pembangunan masa depan.

title: Pre-QUES
text: Berikut adalah komponen data yang digunakan dalam analisis perubahan lahan: Peta Penggunaan Lahan: Ini adalah sumber utama informasi yang menunjukkan pola dan distribusi penggunaan lahan di suatu area. Peta Unit Perencanaan Daerah: Sebagai petunjuk dari area perencanaan, peta ini digunakan untuk menunjukkan bagaimana lahan direncanakan untuk digunakan dan dikembangkan. Tabel Acuan Tipe Penggunaan Lahan: Tabel ini memberikan klasifikasi terperinci tentang berbagai tipe penggunaan lahan. Tabel Acuan Kelas Unit Perencanaan: Ini membantu kita memahami klasifikasi dan karakteristik dari unit-unit perencanaan yang berbeda.

title: Pre-QUES
code: #Crosstab at landscape level crosstab_landscape <- crosstab_result %>%    select(-Kabupaten) %>%    group_by_at(setdiff(names(.), "Freq")) %>%   summarise(Freq = sum(Freq), .groups = "drop") %>%    abbreviate_by_column( c("NTT_LC90", "NTT_LC20"), remove_vowels = FALSE)

what: 3. Hasil analisis pada tingkat unit perencanaan
title: Pre-QUES
code: pu_names <- crosstab_result %>%    pull(Kabupaten) %>% unique()  results_list <- purrr::map(pu_names,                             ~ lcc_summary_by_pu(crosstab_tbl = crosstab_result,                                                 pu_column = "Kabupaten",                                                 pu_name = .x,                                                 sankey_area_cutoff = 1000,                                                 n_top_lcc = 10)) #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq #> Selecting by Freq  results_list <- set_names(results_list, pu_names)

what: An R package for land use planning and management of multiple environmental services

text: experiment package core functions LUMENS R package. packaging functions, LUMENS developers benefit improved code organization, version control, testing capabilities. proposed exercise primarily rely devtools.

title: An R package for land use planning and management of multiple environmental services
text: can install current version LUMENSR GitHub: Packaging LUMENS functions R package allow developers selectively load functions need, reducing memory footprint improving speed analyses. package also come built-testing frameworks via testthat, allowing developers write tests functions catch bugs early development process. addition, packaging LUMENS functions R package make easier developers write detailed documentation functions, reducing time required onboarding support. also allow greater modularity organization, developers selectively update improve specific functions without modify entire codebase.

what: Replace Column Values with Shorter Version — abbreviate_by_column
title: Replace Column Values with Shorter Version — abbreviate_by_column
text: function shortens character column values data frame removing vowels first character, also provides option disable vowel removal. replaces spaces underscores removes characters slash. column names provided, function attempts find use first character column data frame.

title: Replace Column Values with Shorter Version — abbreviate_by_column
Replace Column Values with Shorter Version — abbreviate_by_column
text: df data frame. col_names character vector specifying names columns abbreviated. NULL (default), function attempts use first character column. remove_vowels logical value indicating whether remove vowels column values first character. Default FALSE.

title: Replace Column Values with Shorter Version — abbreviate_by_column
text: data frame specified columns abbreviated.

title: Replace Column Values with Shorter Version — abbreviate_by_column
code: df <- data.frame(   col1 = c("Hutan lahan kering sekunder / bekas tebangan", "Savanna / Padang rumput"),   col2 = c("Hutan lahan kering sekunder", "Savanna"),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) abbreviate_by_column(df, c("col1", "col2"), remove_vowels=TRUE) #>                          col1                        col2 #> 1 Hutan lahan kering sekunder Hutan lahan kering sekunder #> 2                     Savanna                     Savanna

what: Abbreviate a column of a lookup table — abbreviate_lookup
title: Abbreviate a column of a lookup table — abbreviate_lookup
text: function takes data frame (df) name column (col_name) input, returns modified version data frame additional abbr column containing abbreviated versions text specified column. abbreviation done removing vowels words, except vowel first character word. column name specified, function use first character column data frame. input data frame least one column, specified column exist character column, function stop return error message.

title: Abbreviate a column of a lookup table — abbreviate_lookup
Abbreviate a column of a lookup table — abbreviate_lookup
text: df data frame used lookup table. Must least one column. col_name name column abbreviate. NULL, first character column used.

title: Abbreviate a column of a lookup table — abbreviate_lookup
text: tibble additional abbr column containing abbreviated versions text specified column.

what: Calculate land cover frequency for multiple raster layers — calc_lc_freq
title: Calculate land cover frequency for multiple raster layers — calc_lc_freq
text: function takes multiple raster layers input returns frequency table layer, sorted count last raster layer descending order. input terra's rast object allowed.

title: Calculate land cover frequency for multiple raster layers — calc_lc_freq
Calculate land cover frequency for multiple raster layers — calc_lc_freq
text: raster_list list raster layers single raster layer.

title: Calculate land cover frequency for multiple raster layers — calc_lc_freq
text: dataframe frequency tables.

title: Calculate land cover frequency for multiple raster layers — calc_lc_freq
code: if (FALSE) { library(tidyverse)  # Create a vector of raster file names lc_maps <- c("kalbar_LC11.tif", "kalbar_LC20.tif") %>%   # Apply LUMENSR_example function to each file in the vector   map(~ LUMENSR_example(.x)) %>%   # Convert each file to a raster object   map(~ terra::rast(.x)) %>%   # Add a legend to each raster object using a provided lookup table   map(~ add_legend_to_categorical_raster(raster_file = .x, lookup_table = lc_lookup_klhk))  # Calculate the frequency table for each raster object in the list freq_table <- calc_lc_freq(lc_maps)  # Print the resulting frequency table print(freq_table) }

title: Get the top n rows of the input data frame — calc_top_lcc

what: Create Crosstab From Raster List — create_crosstab
title: Create Crosstab From Raster List — create_crosstab
text: function takes list raster files, creates stack, returns frequency table (crosstab) stack. frequency table filtered remove rows frequency zero.

title: Create Crosstab From Raster List — create_crosstab
Create Crosstab From Raster List — create_crosstab
text: raster_list list 'SpatRaster' objects.

title: Create Crosstab From Raster List — create_crosstab
text: data frame representing crosstab input rasters.

title: Create Crosstab From Raster List — create_crosstab
code: if (FALSE) {   # Read in the legend for raster data   subset_legend <- LUMENSR::lc_lookup_klhk    # Read raster files   raster_files <- c("kalbar_LC11.tif", "kalbar_LC15.tif", "kalbar_LC20.tif") %>%     map(LUMENSR_example) %>%     map(rast)    # Loop through raster files   raster_list <- map(raster_files,                             ~apply_lookup_table(raster_file = .x,                                                 lookup_lc = subset_legend))    # Turn raster files into a frequency table   crosstab_result <- create_crosstab(raster_list) }

code: data(lc_lookup_klhk_sequence) head(lc_lookup_klhk_sequence) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   Value PL20                                         color_pallette #>   <int> <chr>                                        <chr>          #> 1     1 Hutan lahan kering primer                    #006600        #> 2     2 Hutan lahan kering sekunder / bekas tebangan #009933        #> 3     3 Hutan rawa primer                            #663300        #> 4     4 Hutan rawa sekunder / bekas tebangan         #996600        #> 5     5 Hutan mangrove primer                        #666633        #> 6     6 Hutan mangrove sekunder / bekas tebangan     #999900

what: Summarize land cover changes by planning unit — lcc_summary_by_pu
title: Summarize land cover changes by planning unit — lcc_summary_by_pu

title: Summarize land cover changes by planning unit — lcc_summary_by_pu
code: lcc_summary_by_pu(   crosstab_tbl,   pu_column,   pu_name,   sankey_area_cutoff,   n_top_lcc = 10 )

title: Summarize land cover changes by planning unit — lcc_summary_by_pu
text: crosstab_tbl data frame containing least 2 columns land cover types (character, numeric, factor) "Freq" column containing numeric values. pu_column character string representing column name planning unit crosstab_tbl. pu_name character string representing name planning unit. sankey_area_cutoff numeric value indicating minimum area changes displayed Sankey plot. n_top_lcc integer representing number top land cover changes displayed. Default 10.

title: Summarize land cover changes by planning unit — lcc_summary_by_pu
text: list containing Sankey plot (sankey_pu) data frame top land cover changes (luc_top_pu).

what: Historical Temperature data for East Nusa Tenggara — ntt_admin
title: Historical Temperature data for East Nusa Tenggara — ntt_admin
text: subset WorldClim version 2.1 climate data 1970-2000. version released January 2020; 30 seconds (~1 km2) spatial resolution. clipped raster dataset BIO1 = Annual Mean Temperature East Nusa Tenggara. subset WorldClim version 2.1 climate data 1970-2000. version released January 2020; 30 seconds (~1 km2) spatial resolution. clipped raster dataset BIO1 = Annual Mean Temperature Indonesia. spatial dataset containing district boundaries East Nusa Tenggara.

Historical Temperature data for East Nusa Tenggara — ntt_admin
text: RasterLayer object : dimensions number rows, columns, layers resolution x y resolution extent geographical extent crs coordinate reference system values raster values, case representing annual mean temperature RasterLayer object : dimensions number rows, columns, layers resolution x y resolution extent geographical extent crs coordinate reference system values raster values, case representing annual mean temperature SpatialPolygonsDataFrame object 22 features 2 fields: ID Country name Kabupaten District names East Nusa Tenggara

title: Prints a frequency table as an HTML table using the gt package — print_frequency_table
text: df data frame convert HTML table. title title table. Default: "Top 10 Type Land Cover Change". labels named vector column labels use place original column names. Names vector match column names df. Default: NULL (original names used). freq_col name column format frequency. Default: "Freq". table_width width table pixels. Default: 700. font_size font size pixels. Default: 12.

title: Prints a frequency table as an HTML table using the gt package — print_frequency_table
text: gt table object.

title: Prints a frequency table as an HTML table using the gt package — print_frequency_table

what: Pre-QUES Land cover change analysis — ques_pre
title: Pre-QUES Land cover change analysis — ques_pre
text: function preprocesses land cover data visualization, calculation, summarization.

title: Pre-QUES Land cover change analysis — ques_pre
Pre-QUES Land cover change analysis — ques_pre
text: lc_t1 spatRaster object representing land cover data period T1. lc_t2 spatRaster object representing land cover data period T2. admin_ spatRaster object representing planning unit data.

title: Pre-QUES Land cover change analysis — ques_pre
text: list results containing input data visualizations, landscape level results, planning unit level results.

title: Pre-QUES Land cover change analysis — ques_pre
code: if (FALSE) { ## Load and annotate land cover data for period T1 lc_t1_ <- LUMENSR_example("NTT_LC90.tif") %>%   terra::rast() %>%   add_legend_to_categorical_raster(     raster_file = .,     lookup_table = lc_lookup_klhk_sequence   ) ## Load and annotate land cover data for period T2 lc_t2_ <- LUMENSR_example("NTT_LC20.tif") %>%   terra::rast() %>%   add_legend_to_categorical_raster(     raster_file = .,     lookup_table = lc_lookup_klhk_sequence   ) # Load planning unit data admin_z <- LUMENSR_example("ntt_admin_spatraster.tif") %>%   terra::rast() ques_pre(lc_t1_, lc_t2_, admin_z) }

what: Rasterize an sf MULTIPOLYGON object — rasterise_multipolygon
title: Rasterize an sf MULTIPOLYGON object — rasterise_multipolygon
text: function rasterizes sf MULTIPOLYGON object SpatRaster object. function also retains attribute table sf object, assigning categorical ID values raster values. rasterized SpatRaster object also contain legend derived attribute table sf object.

title: Rasterize an sf MULTIPOLYGON object — rasterise_multipolygon
Rasterize an sf MULTIPOLYGON object — rasterise_multipolygon
text: sf_object sf MULTIPOLYGON object. must contain attribute table, least one categorical ID (numeric). raster_res numeric vector specifying resolution raster. Default c(100,100). field character string specifying field name used rasterization sf object. Default "ID".

title: Rasterize an sf MULTIPOLYGON object — rasterise_multipolygon
text: SpatRaster object rasterized version input sf object, legend derived attribute table sf object.

title: Rasterize an sf MULTIPOLYGON object — rasterise_multipolygon
code: rasterise_multipolygon(sf_object = ntt_admin, raster_res = c(100,100), field = "ID") #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 3570, 6884, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 100, 100  (x, y) #> extent      : 52661.8, 741061.8, 8783176, 9140176  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : WGS 84 / UTM zone 51S (EPSG:32751)  #> source(s)   : memory #> categories  : Kabupaten  #> name        :        Kabupaten  #> min value   :     Sumba Tengah  #> max value   : Sumba Barat Daya

title: Visualize Temperature Map — vis_map_temperature
text: function generates ggplot object displays temperature raster data boundary polygon data map. color scale temperature data customized legend labeled degrees Celsius.

title: Visualize Temperature Map — vis_map_temperature
code: vis_map_temperature(   temperature_data,   boundary_data,   boundary_data_column = "Kabupaten",   temp_limit = c(10, 35) )

title: Visualize Temperature Map — vis_map_temperature
text: temperature_data spatial raster object contains temperature data. boundary_data spatial polygon object contains boundary data. boundary_data_column column names relevant mapping temp_limit temperature range degree celcius, default c(10,35)

title: Visualize Temperature Map — vis_map_temperature
text: ggplot object displays temperature map.

title: Visualize Temperature Map — vis_map_temperature
code: ntt_temp_path <- LUMENSR_example("ntt_temp.tif") ntt_temp <-  terra::rast(ntt_temp_path) vis_map_temperature(temperature_data = ntt_temp, boundary_data = ntt_admin)
